text_blocks.text: We'll hear argument now in Number oh oh twelve ninety-three, John Ashcroft versus The American Civil Liberties Union.
Mr. Olson.
[Inaudible]

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mr. Chief Justice, and may it please the Court.

All three branches of our National Government have repeatedly determined that pornography causes substantial, incalculable damage to our children, that assisting parents in protecting children from that damage is a compelling national interest, and that pornography is widely available and readily accessible to our children on the Internet.
The Child Online Protection Act is Congress' response to that urgent national problem.

It was drafted after testimony, hearings, and findings in direct response to explicit and detailed guidance in this Court's nineteen ninety-seven Reno versus ACLU decision explaining how to solve the problem of Internet pornography in a constitutional manner.
COPA directly responds to several of the Court's explicit suggestions in its nineteen ninety-seven Reno versus ACLU decision.

In the first place, Congress gave explicit, substantive meaning to the terms, harmful to minor, utilizing standards developed over several decades by this Court describing what would be prohibited in the terms used by this Court in the context of minors.
I won't I won't gud [: get] into the specifics of that, because those are before the Court, and the Court is quite familiar with them.

The Court the Congress also added, however, in response to this Court's explicit suggestion, the third prong of the so-called Ginsberg-Miller test, that the material taken as a whole would have to lack serious literary, artistic, political, or scientific value for minors, an objective standard developed by this Court to protect the pr- producers of communications.

Congress limited the statute to commercial pornographers at this Court's suggestion, those whose trade or business, in an effort to produce profits, are engaged regularly in the production of explicit sexual material for profit.
[Inaudible]
In in your view, is the provision that it has to be objectionable t- f- from the st- t- to minors, is that a c- a national standard?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, wh- as the reference to community standards in the statute is in the first and second prongs of a three part test.

This Court has introduced that community standard provision to protect the communicator from individualized determinations by jurors, and from particularly sensitive, or or particularly insensitive communities.
The Court has explained again and again that it's an average standard.
It's an adult approach to what might be prohibited from the standpoint of damage to minors.
The Court has repeatedly said that it might be it doesn't n- refer to any specific geographic limitation.

In fact, in the Hamling case and and in the Jenkins case decided by this Court several years ago, the Court made it clear that the the community standards prong does not have to apply to any specific community.
But Mis- Mr.
No-

text_blocks.text: We think that that is a very different question, and and that is not a necessary conclusion for the reason that I said before and that is because, by definition, a national standard for what is displayed as harmful to minors on the web would impact far more protected speech than a national standard for obscenity, which is by definition unprotected for adults as well as minors, and to put it another way, no adult has the right to materials that are obscene in even the most tolerant community.
It seems...
have the right to materials.

is an unconstitutional thing, y- you're going to go to jail just the same, whether you're going to jail for pornography or obscenity.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.

Do you really think that when artnet puts out the Andre Serano photographs, do you think it expects to avoid being held under this statute because of six A that it would hope that the average person applying contemporary community standards would find this material as a whole not designed to appeal to or to pander to the pur- prurient interest, or do you rather think that artnet's protection would surely be sought under C namely, that the material taken as a whole possesses serious literary, artistic, political, or scientific value? Isn't that their real protection?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, they really do not believe it is their protection, and that again is because it says, serious value for minors, and that, of course, is one of the primary distinctions between this category and obscenity.
There are many people who would think that the fine art...
I guess I might be go back to that, but I didn't get an answer.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, Your Honor...
a thing.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, Your Honor, the the Government itself is saying that...
artnet won...
I'm asking for your opinion.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I- I- I I'm sorry, Your Honor, but they're the ones that are going to...
That may be,

but the very fact that your clients could be prosecuted does not mean they win this case, because after all, they might be prosecuted under Miller, too, and everyone agrees that that's the law, so I'm asking you for your opinion, if you can find an example of a work of art that would have serious value for a twenty-one-year-old but not for a minor.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, with respect, we believe that all of the exhibits that we have put in, the artistic ones and the literary works, the column, the the nude artworks by several clients, all of these could be targeted under the statute, and again, what the effect, the First Amendment effect of the statute is whether or not our clients legitimately feel like they have to self-censor under this law as compared to the obscenity law.
Are you saying that you have to give some effect to Congress' words? It didn't say serious value, period.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: so for...
the Court to say, well, Congress you just used those words, they didn't mean anything.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Yes, Your Honor, and and the history of the harmful-to-minors definition, that is one of the primary points.
But I thought you might I mean...
I thought that the word, for example, for minors comes out of cases that permit the Government to require certain magazines to be placed in certain places in the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: bookstores,
or in the retail...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: shops,
with brown...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: covers,
so perhaps there's some experience, since we have worked with the word for...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: minors,
of something that has to be done under that law, but doesn't fall within Miller.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and...
Yes, absolutely.
in fact...
then it's you're saying, which was an issue last time around, it it's up to the parent, Government can do nothing.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, we believe that Congress did two things already that it that we're not challenging here.
Well, of course, all all this goes to these other aspects of the statute.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: As...
as I understand where we are in the argument,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Right.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: the the court of appeals decided for reasons that I I I think we cannot criticize on this record that it's going to sustain this injunc- injunction based on the community p- standards problem, and we're asking you, if the s- community standard is national, doesn't that solve that problem,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.

and I'm coming away from this argument w- with the impression that you're saying, well, I'm not going to bother to help you on that, because there are so many other things in the statute I want to talk about.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Yeah, I'm sorry.
doesn't that doesn't help help me answer this question.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: and I and I don't mean to leave that impression.
But is it not...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: true that...
standard can't be enforced with any jury.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I don't think that it can, because again jurors are going to have to enforce that.
their own...
community.
Then you're and I I I don't mean this dismissively, but I think we have to accept this.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, I'm saying that there isn't any way to make it a crime to display material harmful to minors on the web.
Yeah.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: That is our position, and and again, that we believe is very consistent with with many other statutes that have recently been struck down by the Court.
No, but I'm I'm I'm not again, I'm not asking you the global...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: question.
understand.
I'm just asking you the question that goes to the specific issue that we took for review, and that is the the legitimacy of baiksing [: basing] basing an injunction, or sustaining the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: district...
court's injunction...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.
on the community standards portion of the...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: statute,

and and all my question to you is simply, I take it you're saying that there is no way to write a standard into the statute, call it community, call it national, call it some third thing that you dream up, that will ever suffice constitutionally.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: There is no way to do it, and again, I I do want to be clear that I I don't think that we can divorce the rest of the language of the statute, even aside from the deterrence issues, and what I mean by that is, because the statute was written so broadly as to cover anybody who had even just one image, for example, because the statute was written to include not just images but text, I think, you know, e- I think those problems still remain even just looking at the textual language, even if you're focusing just on the the community standard versus the national standard, and that's another reason why we don't think that fixing that problem is enough to save the statute.
May I ask another...

it's another jerded [: general] general question? Do you think there's any way in which Congress can deal with the problem of what they call teasers, which everyone would agree would violate the standard here, but and would also not have serious artistic value?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.
which again...
I'm assuming not ob- nonobscene...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Nonobscene.
clearly pornographic...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: hm...
teasers.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm Well, I mean I I I I have course don't want to be the one to rewrite the statute but I I do think, as I...
suggested before, that if they...
if it's your position that that's beyond the power of Congress to control.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I think that a statute that did just apply, for example, to web sites who were actually selling things already this one isn't limited to that and secondly, web sites who the predominant portion of their site was actually harmful to minors.
You still haven't answered my question.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Justice Stevens, m- m- my my answer is that I think if they if they wrote a statute are you asking me whether I think that would that statute would be unconstitutional also, because of course, I have to argue yes, it would be, but it was certainly be you don't have to bel- believe me on that.
clear that that...
one, right?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that would be a that's what I mean.
be more narrowly tailored to the...

there is a genuine problem that Congress is trying to address, and if your position is you just forget about it, that you've got to live with the problem, that's quite a different position than if you think, well, there's a less restrictive alternative that would accomplish what the Congress is trying to do, and you're suggesting to me there isn't a less restrictive alternative.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Well, the less restrictive alternative for actually protecting children is the user-based mechanisms, and that again, the Congress itself found to be actually more effective at protecting children.
What what would Congress do, pass a...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: law requiring...
parents at their own expense to impose user-based screening?

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, we certainly believe that the...
Federal Government could...
That is not a solution within the power of Congress.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: N- no and we don't think it needs to be, because we think, of course, the ultimate decision ought to be resting on parents, where it always has, to make a...
decision as to whether they believe...
Justice Stevens,

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.
in your capacity as a lawyer, the that whatever statute Congress came up with, you would believe in that capacity was unconstitutional.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: [Inaudible]
You're not prepared to say that there's any statute that is constitutional.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: W- we are not prepared to say that any statute which significantly burdens adult speech is is constitutional, and I think that is very consistent with the opinions of this Court, as in the Playboy case and the Denver Area case.
Let me...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: ask you a...
modification to my question.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Your Honor, the problem with that would be, if course, without some kind of mechanism that then allowed you know parents to...
No, that's right, the but then...

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: that would...
simplify the problem of p- of the p- of of buying of setting up software that could screen out this stuff.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: I think that it might have some compelled speech concerns, especially, again, where you're talking about a medium where you have these individuals e- just because it's commercial businesses doesn't mean there's a big you know, a lot of employees to make these determinations.
important issues prosecuting the child pornographers.
colloquy with the Government on this subject, and they were candid to say, we're not trying simply to maximize parents' choices.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Mhm.
The Government's saying, we have an independent interest, and we can do something.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Yes, I do believe that that issue came up in the Playboy case last term, and the Court, you know, did rule that again voluntary we can't assume, especially without a record to the contrary, that parents are going to fail to act.
Thank you,
Ms. Beeson.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you.
Mr. Olson, you have four minutes remaining.

roles.role_title: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

roles.role_title: Chief Justice of the United States
roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States

text_blocks.text: Thank you, Mr. Chief Justice.
Thank you, General Olson.
taking your chances.
The case is submitted.

roles.institution_name: Supreme Court of the United States
